description:
Latin (1599) Hutter Polyglot - NT (Study Bible)

The Hutter Polyglot New Testament, published in 1599, is a notable multilingual compilation of the Gospels. It presents the complete text of the New Testament in parallel columns of twelve languages: Syriac, Hebrew, Greek, Latin, German, Bohemian, Italian, Spanish, French, English, Danish, and Polish. This edition has been frequently recognized by scholars as "The Study New Testament" due to its comprehensive approach to presenting the biblical text in various languages. The Hutter Polyglot serves as a valuable resource for comparative biblical studies, linguistics, and the historical study of scriptural translations, offering insights into the interpretation and dissemination of the New Testament across different cultures and languages.
